subject: p13606683
Findings: The lungs remain hyperinflated, with multiple areas of hyperlucency and scarring in the left lung base. No focal consolidation. Chronic pleural thickening with blunting of the left costophrenic angle. No pneumothorax. Heart size is borderline enlarged. Prosthetic aortic valve and median sternotomy wires. The stomach is newly distended, with internal air-fluid level, and closely abuts the anterior left hemidiaphragm. Mild acromioclavicular arthropathy.
Impression: Chronic obstructive airways disease, without acute process. Distended stomach.
